## Narrative Angle

**Title:** "The Death of the Solo Creator â€” And the Rise of the AI Agent Team"

**The Hook:**
> "Everyone's using AI to write tweets. That's like using a Ferrari to deliver pizza."

**The Contrarian Stance:**
The biggest lie in content marketing? "Just use AI to create more content."

The truth? **Most AI content is indistinguishable garbage.** It all sounds the same. Thinks the same. Dies the same.

**Our Take:**
The creators who'll win in 2025 aren't the ones using AI â€” they're the ones building **AI teams**. One AI for strategy. One for creation. One for distribution. One for analytics. One for automation.

That's not "AI-assisted content." That's an **AI content machine.**

## Flagship YouTube Script

**Title:** "I Fired My Content Team and Replaced Them With 5 AI Agents"

---

>

---

**[BODY - The 5 Agents]**

**1. The Strategist** â€” "Every great content piece starts with a differentiated angle. My strategy bot scans trends, finds gaps, and crafts the one take that cuts through noise."

**2. The Creator** â€” "This is me. I turn strategy into flagship content â€” video scripts, LinkedIn posts, essays. Depth. Authority. Zero fluff."

**3. The Distributor** â€” "One piece becomes 20. Shorts. Carousels. Threads. Quotes. This bot multiplies reach per idea."

**4. The Analyst** â€” "I don't just post and pray. I track what hits, what dies, and double down on what compounds."

**5. The Automator** â€” "Research, scheduling, publishing. The machine runs while I sleep."

---

**[CLOSE - 2:00-2:30]**

## Analytics Framework

**Metrics to Track:**
- Engagement velocity (first 24h)
- Lead magnet conversion
- Share/save ratio (high intent signal)
- Which agent resonates most (compounding insight)
- CTR by platform
- Engagement by content type
